newsitem.title: USA: Comshare names chief executive officer.
newsitem.headline: Comshare names chief executive officer.

text.p: Comshare Inc said Monday that Dennis Ganster, 46, was named president and chief executive officer.

He succeeds T. Wallace Wrathall, who resigned, the company said, for personal reasons and "his view that the company is ready for new, energetic leadership to move it successfully to its next phase." Ganster's appointment as president and chief executive officer is effective immediately.
Comshare said Wrathall will continue to serve on its board.
In a statement, Daniel Carroll, chairman, said Wrathall recommended Ganster for the president's job.
Ganster joined Comshare in 1972 and served in key management positions in sales, marketing and product development.
